messageBody:
Kamal Ahmed wrote:

> Is there a special way to test non static methods with JUnit? Or they are
> treated the same way as static methods.

JUnit doesn't know what method you're testing, so I suppose the answer
to your question is "no". I don't really understand the question,
though, so I can't be any surer.

> Here is the reason why I asked this question. After reading this article
> (below). It is rather "back to basics" but sometimes I find it useful to go
> to "root"

This article, while cute, takes a long time to say something /very/
simple: make all methods static unless the compiler says they can't be
static. If you want to make a method instance-level that can be
class-level, then you're probably hardcoding something that will
eventually, through some refactoring, become stored in a field.

Take care.
